alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 12:47AM EDT until April 01 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Hancock County in northwestern Ohio... * Until 130 AM EDT. * At 1246 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Deshler to near Ottoville to near Celina, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Findlay, Fostoria, Bluffton, McComb, Arlington, Arcadia, Rawson, Vanlue, Van Buren, Mount Blanchard, Benton Ridge, Jenera, Mount Cory and Williamstown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
